caption.p: NC-5 suppression of A/FM/1/47 (H1N1) influenza viral replication and its effect on NP and M1 protein synthesis. ( A) Fluorescence microscopy images of NC-5-treated (10–80 μM) H1N1-infected MDCK cells with 1.5 × 10 3 TCID50 at 24 h post-infection. Oseltamivir carboxylate (OC) (10 μM) was used as a positive control. ( B) MDCK cells were infected with 1.5 × 10 3 TCID50 of H1N1, treated with NC-5 (10–80 μM) or OC (10 μM) and administered 2 h post-infection (p.i.). Cells at 24 h p.i. were harvested and subjected to Western blotting with NP and M1 antibodies. ( C) The results of the Western blot in ( B) were analyzed using ImageJ software. The expression of NP and M1 proteins was quantified. All results are presented as the mean ± S.D. of three independent experiments, ** p <0.01, *** p <0.001 compared with the DMSO-treated group.
